senses.de: The feeling of happiness when you get what you want or need
senses.ex: His new car gave him great satisfaction.

Tips.title: Emotional Reward
Tips.description: Satisfaction often refers to the joy from achieving personal goals or desires.
Tips.example: He smiled with satisfaction after completing the marathon.

Tips.title: Not Instant
Tips.description: Satisfaction might come after some time and effort, rather than immediately.
Tips.example: After years of study, she found satisfaction in her scientific discoveries.

Tips.title: Non-Material Joy
Tips.description: Satisfaction isn't only from material things; it can be from achievements or experiences.
Tips.example: She took satisfaction in helping others, not just from earning money.

senses.de: The act of fulfilling a demand or wish
senses.ex: The hotel attempts to ensure the satisfaction of all its guests.

Tips.title: Expectation Match
Tips.description: This satisfaction is about meeting or exceeding someone's expectations.
Tips.example: The artist felt satisfaction knowing his work resonated with his audience.

Tips.title: Service Quality
Tips.description: In customer service, satisfaction reflects how well a service is delivered.
Tips.example: The waiter’s attention to detail ensured our complete satisfaction at the dinner.

senses.de: The payment of a debt or fulfillment of an obligation or claim
senses.ex: What satisfaction can I give to him, so he won't sue me?

Tips.title: Debt Clearance
Tips.description: Use 'satisfaction' when debts or obligations are paid off or settled.
Tips.example: She expressed her satisfaction when the mortgage was finally paid off.

senses.de: In law, the fulfillment of a contract or claim
senses.ex: The plaintiff is seeking satisfaction of the unpaid debt.

Tips.title: Legal Fulfillment
Tips.description: Satisfaction in legal contexts involves meeting terms of agreements or settlements.
Tips.example: The defendant provided satisfaction to the claim by compensating the losses.

senses.de: Reparation for a wrong or injury
senses.ex: He seeks satisfaction for his father's murder.

Tips.title: Moral Rectification
Tips.description: It implies making amends for a moral wrong or an injury caused to someone.
Tips.example: The company offered satisfaction to the affected communities by funding local projects.

Tips.title: Historical Duels
Tips.description: Historically, 'satisfaction' referred to the resolution or outcome of a duel.
Tips.example: In historical texts, they demanded satisfaction through a duel for honor.

Amusement.wordDefinition: Amusement refers to a feeling of pleasure or enjoyment that is often associated with laughter and entertainment.

Contentment.wordDefinition:
Contentment refers to a feeling of happiness or fulfillment with what one has or where one is in life. It is a state of being at peace with oneself and one's circumstances.

Both contentment and satisfaction involve feeling happy or fulfilled, but contentment is more about accepting and appreciating what one already has, while satisfaction is about achieving a desired outcome or receiving something that one wanted.

Contentment is applicable in situations where one should be grateful for what they have, such as in one's personal life, career or achievements.

Delight.wordDefinition:
Delight refers to a feeling of intense happiness or joy.

It is used when something exceeds our expectations, brings an unexpected pleasure or surprises us positively. For example, you might say you are delighted by a surprise birthday party or a beautiful sunset.

Delight is a strong positive emotion felt when something surprising happens, while satisfaction is a more general feeling of contentment or fulfilment when things go as planned, or as desired.

Fulfil.wordDefinition:
Fulfil means to achieve or accomplish something that was desired, expected or promised. It is applicable when one wants to complete a task or achieve a goal.

For example, "I want to fulfil my dream of becoming a doctor."

Satisfaction means a feeling of contentment or fulfillment that comes from achieving a desired outcome. It is applicable when one is happy with the result or outcome of something.

In essence, fulfil refers to the action of achieving something, while satisfaction refers to the feeling of contentment that comes from achieving it.

Gratification.wordDefinition:
Gratification means experiencing pleasure as a result of getting what you want immediately, even if it may not be good for you in the long run.

It's often associated with instant happiness, but it doesn't last very long. For example, eating candy when you're hungry is gratification, but it won't sustain you for very long.

Gratification is short-term pleasure while satisfaction is long-term contentment.

It's important to strive for satisfaction over gratification, as the former will ultimately lead to greater happiness and success.

Happy.wordDefinition:
Happy is a feeling of joy, contentment, and pleasure. It is applicable in situations when something good happens or when someone achieves something they have been working towards.

Happy is an emotion experienced in response to a positive event, while satisfaction is a sense of contentment with a situation or outcome.

Joy.wordDefinition:
Joy and satisfaction are both positive feelings, but they have slight differences.

Joy is a feeling of happiness that is often spontaneous and deep, and it comes from within.

Joy is often described as a feeling of elation, excitement, and pleasure.

Joy is a spontaneous feeling of happiness, whereas satisfaction is a sense of contentment that comes with achieving something or fulfilling a goal.

Pleasure.wordDefinition:
Pleasure is a feeling of enjoyment or happiness that you get from doing something. It is a temporary feeling and is usually associated with something that provides immediate gratification or enjoyment, such as eating a delicious meal, watching a movie, or going on a roller coaster.

Pleasure is a temporary feeling of enjoyment or happiness, while satisfaction is a deeper, longer-lasting feeling of contentment and fulfillment that comes from achieving a meaningful goal or completing a task.

quotes.Text: Parents have no greater responsibility in this world than the bringing up of their children in the right way, and they will have no greater satisfaction as the years pass than to see those children grow in integrity and honesty and make something of their lives.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.Text: Unknown in Paris, I was lost in the great city, but the feeling of living there alone, taking care of myself without any aid, did not at all depress me. If sometimes I felt lonesome, my usual state of mind was one of calm and great moral satisfaction.
quotes.Title: Polish Scientist
quotes.Name: Marie Curie

quotes.Text: The value of life lies not in the length of days, but in the use we make of them... Whether you find satisfaction in life depends not on your tale of years, but on your will.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.Text: I am probably the most selfish man you will ever meet in your life. No one gets the satisfaction or the joy that I get out of seeing kids realize there is hope.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Jerry Lewis

quotes.Text: Disciplining yourself to do what you know is right and important, although difficult, is the highroad to pride, self-esteem, and personal satisfaction.
quotes.Title: English Leader
quotes.Name: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.Text: Satisfaction consists in freedom from pain, which is the positive element of life.
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.Text: To be able to look back upon ones life in satisfaction, is to live twice.
quotes.Title: Lebanese Poet
quotes.Name: Khalil Gibran

quotes.Text: No money is better spent than what is laid out for domestic satisfaction.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.Text: My satisfaction comes from my commitment to advancing a better world.
quotes.Title: Sociologist
quotes.Name: Faye Wattleton

quotes.Text: Work satisfaction is important to me.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Govinda
